programme.desc: Lamar Jackson led the Ravens to a 28-25 win over the Cowboys, throwing clutch passes and rushing for 274 yards. Derrick Henry ran for 151 yards and two touchdowns. Despite a late Dallas rally, Baltimore held on, avoiding an 0-3 start for the first time since 2015.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.desc: Just 50 players return on Day 6 of the WSOP Main Event as Marcel Luske headlines the feature table along with John Murphy. programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: There are 32 players remaining on Day 6 of the WSOP Main Event. Chip leader Greg Raymer headlines the feature table along with Josh Arieh and Dan Harrington. The elimination of Chris Ferguson leaves Harrington as the sole Main Event champion remaining, while the field is reduced to just 17 players.

programme.title: FRIDAY NIGHT POKER
programme.desc: Watch a replay of the second Friday Night Poker cash game! Bryn Kenney, Lauren Roberts, Jamie Kerstetter, Alan Richardson, Ken Kohl, and Tia Kajah headline an entertaining and action-packed $5/$10 cash game. Jeff Platt, Brent Hanks, and Amanda Leatherman call the action and Daniel Negreanu makes a guest appearance!

programme.title: Poker After Dark
programme.desc: Take an intimate look at one table as it develops over a week of play. The world's best players come together to play a single-table tournament or cash game as your favorite players look to beat the best on Poker After Dark.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The WSOP Main Event plays down to the final table as former champion Dan Harrington, along with Dutchman Marcel Luske look to make a run at being one of the final nine. Plenty of others will fall short, but who will reach the 2004 WSOP Main Event final table?

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The final table of the 2004 WSOP Main Event sees Greg Raymer hold the chip lead ahead of Matt Dean, Josh Arieh, Glenn Hughes, Dan Harrington, David Williams, Al Krux, Mike McLain, and Mattias Andersson. All eyes are on the $5 million first-place pirze and the title of 2004 World Champion.

programme.title: The Perfect Challenge
programme.desc: Alfred and Della Hughes, a successful couple, face marital strife. Alfred's neglect and an affair strain their bond. Della, overwhelmed by household duties, feels undervalued. Their children witness their parents' escalating conflicts, leading to a tumultuous breakdown. Though their children plead for unity, divorce looms. A family intervention, sparked by a heartfelt gift, forces them to confront their deep-seated love and the possibility of reconciliation.

programme.title: Cooperating Criminals
programme.desc: Tony's ambition ignites a powder keg of betrayal. Driven by Bianca's manipulation, he pushes his pill operation, ignoring Jay's warnings. As DEA Agent Harrison closes in, Jay battles his past to protect Tony. A dangerous deal with Marco, escalates the chaos, leading to overdose and murder plots. Now, Tony faces a stark choice: witness or prison.

programme.title: Who's Watching Us

programme.desc: Two friends rise to power as crime bosses, facing off against formidable enemies while their own relationship is tested in a tense showdown.

programme.title: A Wolf's Cries

programme.title: Westward the Women
programme.desc: There's a deficit of good, honest women in the West, and Roy Whitman (John McIntire) wants to change that. His solution is to bring a caravan of over 100 mail-order brides from Chicago to California. It will be a long, difficult and dangerous journey for the women. So Whitman hires hardened, cynical Buck Wyatt (Robert Taylor) to be their guide across the inhospitable frontier. But as disaster strikes on the trail, Buck just might discover that these women are stronger than he thinks.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Mr. Proctor, a friend of the Derringer family, is sent to New Orleans with a message from a former general in the Civil War. But before he is able to relay the message to Yancy, Mr. Proctor is assassinated, leaving Yancy to uncover the mystery behind the Confederate half dollar Mr. Proctor was carrying when he died.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Yancy investigates counterfeit money that's being passed throughout the French Quarter. His investigation brings him into contact with Lonesome Jackson, a miner who recently struck in rich & seeking a wife. The Treasury Department suspects Jackson because of the large bankroll he's carrying, but Yancy believes that the miner is being set up as a patsy by the real counterfeiters.

programme.title: 100 Rifles
programme.desc: When half-breed Indian Yaqui Joe (Burt Reynolds) robs an Arizona bank, he is pursued by dogged lawman Lyedecker (Jim Brown). Fleeing to Mexico, Joe is imprisoned by General Verdugo (Fernando Lamas), who is waging a war against the Yaqui Indians. When Lyedecker attempts to intervene, he is thrown into prison as well. Working together, the two escape and take refuge in the hills, where Lyedecker meets beautiful Yaqui freedom fighter Sarita (Raquel Welch) and begins to question his allegiances.

programme.title: Take a Hard Ride
programme.desc: Following the death of his employer (Dana Andrews), cowboy Pike (Jim Brown) undertakes a perilous endeavor to transport $86,000 to the widow of his boss. With hundreds of miles of desert landscape and ruthless and greedy men between him and his destination, Pike teams up with Tyree (Fred Williamson), an untrustworthy gambler, to better his odds at making it alive. As Pike and Tyree face one attack after another, no one poses more of a threat than Kiefer (Lee Van Cleef), a crafty bounty hunter.

programme.title: The Last Command
programme.desc: In this fact-based film, legendary Texan Jim Bowie (Sterling Hayden) attempts to come to a nonviolent compromise with Mexican President Santa Anna (J. Carrol Naish), but the negotiations soon turn sour. Consuelo de Quesada (Anna Maria Alberghetti), a Mexican girl with close ties to Jim, then warns him that Santa Ana's men are planning to invade. So Jim, Davy Crockett (Arthur Hunnicutt) and a tiny crew of courageous Texans hide out in an abandoned mission, awaiting the violent confrontation.

programme.title: Tim Minchin and the Heritage Orchestra: Live at the Royal Albert Hall
programme.desc: Tim Minchin is back and bringing the house down - with the 55 piece Heritage Orchestra!! This show includes brand new songs, as well as the much loved Minchin classics.

programme.title: Sinbad: Make Me Wanna Holla
programme.desc: A stand-up special covering the everything from the life advice his parents gave him to people with no talent having clothing lines and more.

programme.title: Zane Lamprey: Tender Looks
programme.desc: Comedian and beer enthusiast Zane Lamprey shares stories about his misadventures while traveling the world and drinking.

programme.title: Travis Nelson: To Touch a Cloud
programme.desc: Magical lifeguard whistles, ice clouds and a skydiver’s bucket list come up for a comic who hasn’t recovered since Mother Nature’s growing stick.

programme.title: Kim Kerley: Do You Know Her?
programme.desc: Having spent much of her teens homeless, this comic has seen things in life that many never see. She chooses to find the funny in those situations.

programme.title: Sam Tallent: Waiting for Death to Claim Us
programme.desc: The comic launches his 13-date tour in sold-out theaters, house parties, and rib-joints across the U.S. just in time for a once-in-a-century pandemic.

programme.title: Russell Peters: Deported
programme.desc: The hilarious Russell Peters performs at a stadium in Mumbai where he laments gaining weight, spoofs Bollywood vocals, and talks about being a dad.

programme.title: Jill-Michele Meleán: White/Latina
programme.desc: The half-Bolivian, half-Irish comic talks about navigating vastly different cultural identities while creating her own brand of funny.

programme.title: Jesus Trejo: Stay at Home Son
programme.desc: First-generation Mexican-American comic Jesus Trejo is here with jokes and riffs about growing up in L.A. County and other hilarious facts of life.

programme.title: Joey Coco Diaz: Sociably Unacceptable
programme.desc: It's been 25 years in the making and now Uncle Joey Diaz is at Seeso for his first socially unacceptable special. Prepare yourselves, savages.

programme.title: Ian Abramson: The Heist
programme.desc: Comedian Ian Abramson mixes performance art and stand-up to create one of history's most bananas comedy specials.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Arguing With Myself
programme.desc: Join Jeff and his outspoken felt pals: Walter, Peanut, José Jalapeño, Bubba J, and Sweet Daddy Dee for an evening of laughs and observations.

programme.title: Jeff Garcia: Low Budget Madness
programme.desc: Shot live at San Manuel Indian Bingo and Casino in Highland, CA, Jeff Garcia's Low Budget Madness is packed with hilarious sketches that will leave you in stitches and remind you why audiences all over the world can't get a enough of Jeff Garcia!

programme.title: Billy Gardell: Halftime
programme.desc: The star of TV’s “Mike and Molly” returns to where the funny began for him, his hometown, Pittsburgh, in a live show saluting working-class America.

programme.title: Bryan Callen: Never Grow Up
programme.desc: The comedian examines the way our modern culture works, and wonders why we feel the need to view each other in such a narrow box.

programme.title: Chris Porter: Ugly & Angry
programme.desc: Last Coming Standing alum, Chris Porter, gives his look on drugs, growing old, women’s fashion, and his love for Taco Bell.

programme.title: Jim Breuer: Let's Clear the Air
programme.desc: The SNL alum, radio host, and film actor clears the air at his live event, chronicling his transformation from oddball child to ultimate family man.

programme.title: Jim Breuer: And Laughter For All
programme.desc: Marriage and parenthood won't keep die-hard metalhead comedian Jim Breuer from losing his manic sense of humor in this hilarious live show.

programme.title: Dino Vigo: All In
programme.desc: A skilled writer, as well as performer-Vigo seems poised to take the comedy world by storm and yet remains remarkably grounded in his approach to his craft.

programme.title: Aries Spears: Comedy Blueprint
programme.desc: The MADTV alum takes the stage in Philadelphia to deliver jokes and impressions, where no one is spared from his ferociously aggressive comic style.

programme.title: The Gallagher Collection
programme.desc: In his 1985 special, Gallagher isn't really the bookkeeper, but he does know the three things that appeal to everyone: Money, Money, and Money. But forget all that... here comes the amazing Sledge-o-Matic!

programme.title: Chris Waitkus: Not Rocket Science
programme.desc: In this debut stand-up comedy special, Chris Waitkus takes the stage in front of a live audience at the Zephyr Theater in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Samson Crouppen: Proof I Was Here
programme.desc: In the first stand-up special to be minted as an NFT, Samson Crouppen shares stories about his 20-year career working as a comic in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Tim Minchin: So F*****g Rock
programme.desc: Superstar musician and comedian, Tim Minchin brings you So F*****g Rock, Live. Filmed at London’s Bloomsbury Theatre in May 2008. Includes the fan favorites: Inflatable You, Rock 'n Roll Nerd, Peace Anthem for Palestine, Canvas Bags and loads more!

programme.title: Myq Kaplan: Small, Dork and Handsome
programme.desc: Wise guy Myq Kaplan is Small, Dork and Handsome. The might of Myq's manic comedy machine is sure to stupefy and amuse as he describes his skewed spin on the oddities of life. Filmed live in Boston.

programme.title: Moshe Kasher: Live in Oakland
programme.desc: Back on his home turf Oakland-bred comic and best-selling author, Moshe Kasher, finds comedy in uproarious stories about the people he's met and how they see him.

programme.title: Matt Bergman: Mostly Nice
programme.desc: A mixture of new material sprinkled with some favorites from DC comedian Matt Bergman filmed in Dallas, Texas.

programme.title: Sklar Brothers: Hipster Ghosts
programme.desc: Performing in Chicago, the Sklar Brothers tackle topics such as politics, parenting, canine racism, and who might haunt us in the afterlife.

programme.title: Josh Blue: Sticky Change
programme.desc: Quipster Josh Blue hits the stage where he turns his cerebral palsy and cross-cultural marriage into comedy gold.

programme.title: Natalia Valdebenito: Gritona
programme.desc: Comic Natalia Valdebenito explores topics once considered taboo in Latin America.

programme.desc: Harris's job is in jeopardy after joining a protest she strongly believes in, leading to tense discussions within the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben's mom arrives after an unexpected death and unveils shocking information from the past; Becky and Emilio spend more time together.

programme.desc: Harris brings home her new friend, Josh, leaving the family questioning his intentions; Becky and Ben's attempt to build a closet stirs up family drama.

programme.desc: Darlene earns a promotion at Wellman Plastics, while Ben decides on a new career path; Jackie tries an herbal tea. and it leads to an emotional revelation.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Chuck's new purchase of a boat creates a rift; Darlene hires her first assistant at Wellman's Plastics but soon realizes she is anything but helpful.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene starts to feel the pressures of her new job; Dan attempts to help Ben out at the hardware store, but the two don't always agree on how to run the business.

programme.desc: Mark is convinced he has COVID-19; Becky and Harris team up to confront Josh, who has been 'ghosting' Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan feels helpless when Louise refuses to let him put himself at risk for her; when Jackie learns the competing restaurants are posting negative reviews.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky meets up with an old friend and feels pressured to impress him; Dan questions his position at the hardware store, leading to a massive fight between him and Ben.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky is working double shifts and taking classes at the community college, resulting in less time with her daughter; Dan decides to foster an elderly dog.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene learns shocking news about a friend; the Conners family comes together to help someone close to them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan encounters a surprise visitor who shares some unsolicited advice, leaving him feeling guilty; Darlene welcomes a new employee to Wellman Plastics.

programme.desc: Darlene makes a decision about her trip to Hawaii, leading to a heated encounter with Barb; Becky gives a presentation on addiction to Mark's class.

programme.desc: Two proposals bring big changes to the Conner family; Jackie uses her Jeopardy infamy to her advantage.

programme.desc: The Conners continue to deal with the pandemic while navigating breakups and newfound sobriety, all while planning an upcoming wedding.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Ben declines Darlene's proposal, she starts to ponder why she tends to be so negative in life, prompting her to start a journey of self-discovery, which leads to Pastor Phil.

programme.desc: Part of Becky's recovery program mandates she make amends with people she has lied to over the years, leading her to meet up again with a former high school friend.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Dan and Louise's wedding day, but it's a far-from-perfect, especially when a weather report forecasts that a tornado is headed for Lanford creating chaos and surprises.

programme.desc: The Conners are ready for Halloween, despite a leaky roof that forces Dan and Louise to cancel their honeymoon

programme.desc: Darlene worries about Mark making friends at his new school; Mark turns to Ben for advice; Becky finds herself thriving in college and starts thinking about her future plans.

programme.desc: Jackie devises an offbeat plan to serve the customers at The Lunch Box, it's anything but smooth; Dan begins to sell furniture to make room for his new bride and her things.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.desc: Two teams comprised of celebrities and civilians against each other in a fast-paced word game with a top prize of $10,000

programme.title: 25 Words or Less

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Twenty brave Brits have volunteered for an expedition to the arctic wastelands of Argentina.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Tonight, twenty brave battlers will take on the wintry weirdness.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Winter Wipeout has the awards show to end all awards shows –The Snow Globes.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: It’s Christmas down on the Winter Wipeout course in Argentina!

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: 20 contestants take on four gruelling courses to win the title of Wipeout Champion.

programme.title: 101 Ways to Leave a Gameshow
programme.desc: Steve Jones hosts the series where contestants are ejected in the most nerve-wracking means ever seen on TV.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the fifth week of the TV Show and none of the participants have been able to cross the Big Balls.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Buoys, Field Goal Swing, Big Donuts and Tippy Tables are some of the over-the-top obstacles in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the last episode of the season and, as usual, contestants face different games!

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Topple towers, Cookie Cutter, The Tails, Teeter Totters and Crazy Beams are among the over-the-top obstacles on this week’s episode.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: The Almost Impossible Gameshow
programme.desc: Comedy duo The Rubber Bandits provide anarchic commentary and their own twisted, surreal take on the action.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Contestants face different games like The Qualifier, The Crash Mountain, Dizzy Dummies and The Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Dirty Balls, The Wall Swing, The Crusher, Crazy Beams and Big Donuts are among some of the over-the-top obstacles included in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Time again for the world of celebrity to take on the most outrageous obstacle course in the name of charity.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This episode welcomes a set of contestants to take on some hard obstacles for the cash prize and the trophy.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the last episode of the season and the 7 previous winners compete to be the Champion of Champions.

programme.title: The Almost Impossible Gameshow

programme.desc: In this episode, contestants face different games like The Qualifier and The Dizzy Dummies.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: 10 celebrities will be taking the reindeer-drawn celebrity sleigh to the top of the Qualifier.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia

They dish out punishment to Australia’s very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty begins the process of taking out plants which are in the wrong place and either moving or dividing others. He also gives advice on making leaf mould from fallen leaves and how to use it.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Arit Anderson and Frances Tophill visit Wakehurst, Kew's wild botanic garden in Sussex. They not only explore the gardens but also meet the gardeners, joining in on their planting projects and finding out more about the UK's largest conservation project, the Millenium Seed Bank.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe will be casting an expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol will be focusing on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As part of his planning for summer Monty begins to sow annual climbers and gets started on tidying and mulching his borders. In the last of Joe Swift's series on trees, he learns how and when to prune them, and why. We also meet clematis enthusiast, Mike Brown, whose collection fills his garden with colour all summer long, and amongst the brutalist architecture of London's Barbican, Nick Bailey, head gardener of the Chelsea Physic Garden, discovers a hidden tropical oasis.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is in Hampshire with the great horticulturist, Roy Lancaster, appreciating the virtues of the often overlooked St John's wort. Joe Swift is out and about too and visits a very unusual allotment in Tottenham, North London.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives a masterclass on rambling, climbing and shrub roses. He also plants out tender annuals in the jewel garden, and with hot, dry summer days ahead, shares tips for water saving and harvesting.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The show comes from the RHS Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival. Arit Anderson, Toby Buckland and Adam Frost reveal the latest in floral fashions and share highlights of the show gardens and floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Coming from the biggest horticultural event in the North, the RHS Flower Show Tatton Park. Joe Swift and Frances Tophill reveal the latest in garden design, as well as bringing plant perfection from some of the best nurseries in the country.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his spuds and sows seeds for autumn veg. He also shows how to get plants for free by taking cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A celebration of people who are growing their own, from vegetables to flowers, across the UK. At Longmeadow, Monty shares tips and advice on how to get the most out of bargain plants. Meanwhile, Joe visits an extraordinary food project in Bristol.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to his ornamental grass borders, Carol travels to Cheshire to view some heleniums, and Joe is treated to a Jamaican feast when he visits Moor Green Allotments in Birmingham.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: British summer time means that, from Saturday, we all have an extra hour to get out in our gardens in the evenings just as the early spring display is coming into its own. At Longmeadow, Monty Don introduces us to the coppice, a woodland area where his favourite flower, the primrose, is in bloom. As well as enjoying the seasonal colours of spring, it's time to plan the summer display. Monty sows sweet peas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Join Adam Frost in his garden, where he will be giving tips on laying turf, planting succulents and adding perennial plants to his kitchen garden to grow as cut flowers. Joe Swift travels to Marwood Hill Gardens in Devon to explore plants that thrive in moist conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the sweet peas he grew from seed earlier in the year and shows how to keep their display going on into the weeks ahead. Meanwhile, Rachel meets a couple from Hampshire who have created their entire garden around their obsession for one plant, the hosta. Elsewhere, Carol travels to Wales to find out how one man tackled his sloping plot to make a garden on five different levels.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don visits two sets of ambitious gardeners, each facing challenges on a very different scale. One is a tiny urban courtyard in Hackney and the other is a outdoor area for a community.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in his wildlife garden to ensure that there are plenty of plants in flower for early pollinators. Carol Klein meets Stuart Donachie who has embraced every planting opportunity in his shady garden in Herefordshire, and Frances Tophill invites viewers to grow easy summer vegetables along with her as she trials varieties for taste and productivity at RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the Wimbledon tennis championships just around the corner, Joe Swift meets the gardening team responsible for the spectacular floral displays at this world-renowned event.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Join the team as they present the seasonal highlights from across the country visiting stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success. Adam Frost presents from his garden and suggests essential gardening jobs for the weekend.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the borders at Longmeadow hit their stride, it's time to take stock of what's looking good and what needs replacing. Monty shares his tips on how to keep the display going all summer long. There's plenty to do on the vegetable plot too and things are looking promising in the fruit garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill is in her very first garden for a summer catch-up and an update on her progress since moving in. Meanwhile, Adam Frost meets a kindred spirit who explains how gardening saved his life.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Uncover a secret little loft hidden in the woods, surrounded by evergreens and ruffly green bushes and grass -- Bob Ross unveils it all!

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Watch and learn as Bob Ross unfolds this beautifully soft wooded scene with gently rippling brook, all inside an oval shape.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross creates an oval scene with warm brown and gold tones that captures the essence of a lonely forest river.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Travel with Bob Ross along the country back roads as he paints a quiet little home on a meadow with a beautiful, serene sky.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Surround yourself with this gorgeous Bob Ross painting; there's plenty of thick, velvety green grass, trees and foliage to just lose yourself in!

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Such magnificent power and vibrant color in the sea and sky! Watch Bob Ross as he tries to tame this beautiful ocean painting.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Looking back to those 'days of old', Bob Ross paints a delightful little fishing village with luscious leafy trees in an oval.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Winter scenes don't have to be cold! With a touch of the sun's warmth, Bob Ross turns the chill of winter into a golden day.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Grandest of mountains overlooking an incredibly breathtaking waterfall … a Bob Ross painting you must see to believe!

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: A tribute to all Bob Ross friends in New York City, this painting is simply full of exciting cut-out shapes and surprises!

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: For as far as the eye can see -- beautiful rolling hills, birch trees and soft watery reflections; undoubtedly guest artist Steve Ross at his finest.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Warm skies, pleasant valley and purple misty mountains - the perfect place to pitch your tent and enjoy the view with painter Bob Ross.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh heads offshore for the first day of red snapper season with his friend Joe Koenraad.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: In the thrilling season finale of "Goin' Coastal," host Josh Calhoon takes his daughter, Lily, on an unforgettable birthday fishing adventure in Destin, Florida. They target mighty amberjack, battling these fierce fighters, when Lily hooks into a surprising Goliath grouper, leading to an epic showdown. This heartwarming and action-packed episode captures the essence of family, the thrill of the catch, and the beauty of coastal living. Don't miss this special finale filled with love, laughter, and coastal charm.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Ike on Stripers Bassmaster legend Mike Iaconelli joins Nick in a wild time chasing down striped bass blitzes off the Jersey Coast, getting bent rods from the boat and surf.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Trophy Tautog are on the hit list for Nick and his crew as they ply the wrecks and reefs off New Jersey.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: This episode takes the crew to famous Lake Fork in Texas; although known for its great bass fishing, this episode Mark and Xavier will be looking to catch some giant crappie; Mark met Xavier at the Crappie Classic through a mutual relationship they hold with Jenko Fishing.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: Highlighting guests Dalton Smith; Dalton coached Campbellsville University Kayak Bass Team. Fished high school in KY; Mark watched him as a youth angle. Dalton caught two 14lb+ bass on the same day once. The 23-year-old uprooted from his area to follow this dream full time in OH.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: The Direction TV's Annual Military Appreciation Episode. Two good friends, Thomas & Terry McWilliams, help to make this event take place. This episode is dedicated to our service men and women.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: In this episode Mark is excited to return to famous Sam Rayburn to fish with one of the legends of bass fishing, Tommy Martin; they'll discuss and capture some information on Tommy's career on this trip for the episode. Also will note that Mark fished a Bassmaster Open on the lake back in the early 2000's. Another interesting tidbit is that Mark was actually on Sam Rayburn fishing when the space shuttle blew up; he actually heard the explosion and felt the rumble.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With slow pitch jigging being the newest craze, Rush and buddy Dane head out to test some new tackle and go for “mutton or nothing.” Meanwhile in California, Ali gets his hand on the new gear and prepares to hop a flight and join in on the “slow pitch” party with the guys in Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the drastic changes in the Southern California fishery over the past several years, it has been easy to get fixated on targeting large Bluefin tuna and going all out on what many have coined "big fish" fishing. On this episode Ali and Rush take advantage of the many other opportunities this time of year has to offer and switch focus back to the basics, targeting smaller yellowfin, bluefin, and mahi on bait.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor catch two thirds of a slam when they bring Tom’s new Yellowfin 24’ Bay up to Key Largo for some exciting flats fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Captain Mason Baker to sample some early morning Islamorada backcountry baby tarpon action.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: After a successful morning of baby tarpon fishing, Captains Tom Rowland, Rich Tudor and Mason Baker slide over to the legendary downtown Islamorada flats to check on the resurgence of Florida Keys bonefish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head into the Everglades backcountry out of Key Largo to fish the shallow grass flats for tailing redfish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Saltwater Experience Charters’ Captain Garrett Stephens for a trip into the Gulf. When their catches get repeatedly cut off, they decide to bring the massive bull sharks up to the surface for a closer look.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: After wrestling with some massive bull sharks, Captains Tom Rowland, Rich Tudor and guest Captain Garrett Stephens encounter some crazy cobia action and it takes all their strength and skill to keep them away from the sharks.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Capt. Jonathan Moss visits St. Marks, Florida, to fish inshore for Cobia and Redfish with Capt. Leif Lundquist.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With Season 6 in the can, Ali and Rush lookback on some of the places, catches, and memorable moments during this year of “new normal.”

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: In this episode we explore the wrecks and reefs that make Marathon one of the top dive destinations in the world. We will highlight what being done buy groups to restore our fragile coral reefs.

programme.title: Dirty 30
programme.desc: Dirty 30 is a groundbreaking docu-series filmed, edited, and directed by Eric Guarino. In this first episode, we follow Mike Iaconelli to the Bassmaster Elite Series on legendary Lake Okeechobee. As the camera rolls, we dive deep into the fishing world, shedding light on the industry and exploring the untold stories from Ike’s incredible 30-year career on the road.From behind-the-scenes moments to raw, unfiltered insights, this episode peels back the curtain on what it really takes to thrive in professional fishing. Get ready for some dirt, real talk, BIG FISH, and an up-close look at one of the sport’s most legendary figures.Folks at home,Celebrating 30 years in professional bass fishing is an incredible journey, and it wouldn’t be possible without you, the fans. Bass fishing professionally is really all about the fans, and I just want to say how much I appreciate every single one of you. I hope you enjoy the show!NEVER GIVE UP!!! — Ike

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: Jay made it to Austin, Texas, the hill country hub for public water, hungry fish, and innovative anglers.

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: READY TO ROLL!!…almostWe have our bus. We have our boat. And we have Mr. J. Rockfish on board to steer the ship. But before we can hit the road, we’ve got some work to do.The bus…it needs a new motor and maybe some other stuff (TBD) that’s been hiding under 40 years of crust and crud…The boat, it needs some fiberglass work. A casting platform and floor would be cool…maybe a paint job.And Jay, well his gear is pretty shot, and his normally ripped physique has been obscured under some COVID poundage he acquired over the past year or so…And maybe a pedicure and haircut are in order before stepping in front of the camera…First, the bus. A little interior decorating perhaps. The 14 seats built for preschoolers don’t quite accommodate over-sized fishing dudes. And, come to find out, there are no rod racks. No bar. No stereo. No beds. No fly-tying stations. And no beer fridge. How did those kids survive?Time to gut this thing…Check it out! #fishingwithjay

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff team up with their friends from Boss Shotshells in South Dakota for a high-energy upland hunt, pursuing wild pheasants with the help of skilled hunting dogs. The adventure takes a quirky turn with a visit to the iconic Corn Palace.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny joins True North Trout and Koz as they hit the Manistee River for a bit of trout fishing on the fly.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: From country music star Brian Kelley’s big 56’ Sunny Briggs Sportfishing Yacht, to getting caught in a storm aboard a small Hurricane deck boat in the Gulf of Mexico, this episode of Stomping Grounds has host Ryan McVinney exploring boat culture in Florida’s Panhandle region, from the Emerald Coast to The Big Bend and the Forgotten Coast. Brian Kelley, aka “Beach Cowboy”, or BK for short, makes up one half of the country music group Florida Georgia Line (FGL) and has just released his own solo album Sunshine State of Mind. Kelley invites viewers aboard his vessel the “Brittney Marie” which was named after his wife, for a look at the couple’s Stomping Grounds. Songs from his album play on the boat’s sound system - including a tune about shopping for a boat on Boat Trader

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: When Plan A and Plan B don't go as planned, Destin always has a way of bailing you out.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Denise Sanchez was awarded a hunt at G2 following our Hunters Extravaganza drawings. Its great to get to spend time on the ranch with new members of TTHA. Denise gets familiar with a giant and learns about new technology while on this hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our college chapters. Hudson has been a long time member of TTHA as well as serving with the Texas A&M Chapter. We have a great time at G2 in pursuit of Axis deer.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Anyone can be a cowboy—that’s the biggest thing the DIRT crew learned in Texas. From riding bulls in Fort Worth to off-roading in the Chihuahuan desert to forging their own path across this vast state with the help of local trailblazers Liz and Lou Lambert. Lucky for us, they even stopped by Huckberry’s own backyard in Austin for a quick ruck and a couple games of chicken sh*t bingo. When the dust finally settled, we fired up the barbecue for our beefiest feast yet and raised our ranch waters high to 10 DIRT episodes in the can.

programme.title: Gear Lab
programme.desc: Our friend and host of DIRT, Josh Rosen, stopped by the Gear Lab to show us what he packed for our most recent DIRT episode in Alaska.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate – outside – in Palm Beach County FL.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchester’s best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team follows the project of a detailed retrofitting of a Bertram upgrading from one motor to twin engines with the help of an Armstrong Bracket. The team then heads to Boatwrench Inc. to rebuild the carburetor for the Glastron project.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team does a deep dive into a product founded by Engineered Marine Coatings called the Genius Bucket. The Genius Bucket being the ultimate DIY paint kit for those looking to tackle a marine painting job on there own. The team also checks out the capabilities it takes to restoring the older metal rub rail which derived from the Glastron project.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade shows us around some of his investment properties, and Ryan kills a nice bull elk in New Mexico.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade takes us around the hometown hunting grounds and shows us some of the last bits of preparation for the season. An old buck that’s been showing up on camera at night decides to daylight and pays the price.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When the Bay Point Billfish Open returns, we hop on board the Ellie B for some offshore competition and follow the event’s epic dockside party.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin & Meredith’s beautiful Panama City Beach morning is met with a slack tide so a new path to redfish success is found under a popular bridge.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesn’t come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: After several years of shifting focus back to his native whitetails, Dahlke returns to mule deer country with the Muley Freak, Erik Van Woerkom. Follow along on this Utah mule deer hunt.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: For decades, Paul Butski has set the standard in turkey calling. His name is etched into the NWTF Grand National Calling Championships Hall of Fame, and his influence stretches far beyond the stage. He didn’t just win competitions, he shaped the way we talk to turkeys – and more importantly, the way we hunt them.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Todd Rogers embraces the business of being a hunting outfitter as a labor of love. And while so many family-run operations are dwindling in rural America, the Rogers legacy is here to stay. Will Cooper and Josh Dahlke return to western Oklahoma to share this story while pursuing brush-country whitetails in the red dirt.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we dive into how we are using our knowledge and experience to not only get some amazing hunting property, but to have other people pay for it. Sound too good to be true? We also take you on some great hunts we’ve had on our journey flipping land and think back on some memories from the past and what the future is going to look like. We hope you can learn a thing or two in this episode and encourage you to reach out with any questions you may have about this process.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are back in Missouri on our new farm that we’ve recently purchased. We developed our last farm, and did a 1031 tax free exchange to buy this farm so we can develop and sell it later on. This is the first time we’ve seen the property, so we are finding out what we are going to do with it and how we are going to lay it out. Once we get that figured out, we go into the dirty work of planting, moving box stands, and making sure everything is good for hunting season. Fast forward and we have two amazing hunts where both Ryan and myself take awesome bucks with our bows. This one has it all! Do not miss it!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes you on a ride through one of the coolest cities in the south, the historic Natchez, Mississippi. This is an area in which Slade sells a lot of hunting land and being only 40 minutes from where he grew up, Slade is very familiar with all there is to do in the area not only from a recreational standpoint but also for entertainment. Slade takes you through the showing process on a beautiful piece of property and bring it full circle at the closing. You’ll also watch a deer hunt with Slade in Natchez that was featured on Realtree Monster Bucks DVD. This is a jampacked episode with so much to learn and also enjoy. We know you’ll love it.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike visits Crystal River and fishes with one of his Citrus County friends, Capt JC Livingston, where they battle the good, the bad and the ugly that comes with Tarpon fishing!

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike heads to Venice, LA, to explore a unique bayou technique —beach fishing for redfish and black drum in the heart of the Gulf.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike and Dallas King take advantage of a powerful summer tide, hooking into an all-out redfish frenzy where the action never slows down.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons goes to the magical Island nation of Malta to explore the secrets buried beneath the waters.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons goes to the magical Island nation of Malta to explore the secrets buried beneath the waters.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: It's a trip out to God's Grocery Store with country star Styles Haury ashe and Brandon look for Tuna and Snapper to bring home to the family.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons is passionate about catching the mighty Sailfish, andgoes out with his tournament partner and former MLB star, Doug Mankietwicz. Doug has won a World Series and Olympic Gold medal, and now is in search of some Sails.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Capt. Jonathan Moss visits St. Marks, Florida, to fish inshore for Cobia and Redfish with Capt. Leif Lundquist.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Vietnam war veteran Don Weber recounts his amazing journey through survivors guilt, PTSD and starting over.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: From the ground up host Randy Birdsong will take you through the trials and tribulations of owning his first farm and grooming it to be one of the best whitetail hunting properties in the country

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: After several years of shifting focus back to his native whitetails, Dahlke returns to mule deer country with the Muley Freak, Erik Van Woerkom. Follow along on this Utah mule deer hunt.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: When temperatures plummet and the landscape is buried in snow, the whitetail deer’s true resilience is put to the test.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: With bucks on their feet and chasing does, Dan puts his skills and his muzzleloader to the test, hoping to connect with a true Sooner State giant.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through the mountains of western North Carolina, where we stop in Asheville and Cashiers!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through Georgia, where we stop in Helen, Alpharetta and Atlanta!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through South Carolina, where we stop in Clemson, Travelers Rest and Charleston!!

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh heads offshore for the first day of red snapper season with his friend Joe Koenraad.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: In the thrilling season finale of "Goin' Coastal," host Josh Calhoon takes his daughter, Lily, on an unforgettable birthday fishing adventure in Destin, Florida. They target mighty amberjack, battling these fierce fighters, when Lily hooks into a surprising Goliath grouper, leading to an epic showdown. This heartwarming and action-packed episode captures the essence of family, the thrill of the catch, and the beauty of coastal living. Don't miss this special finale filled with love, laughter, and coastal charm.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff team up with their friends from Boss Shotshells in South Dakota for a high-energy upland hunt, pursuing wild pheasants with the help of skilled hunting dogs. The adventure takes a quirky turn with a visit to the iconic Corn Palace.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny joins True North Trout and Koz as they hit the Manistee River for a bit of trout fishing on the fly.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: From country music star Brian Kelley’s big 56’ Sunny Briggs Sportfishing Yacht, to getting caught in a storm aboard a small Hurricane deck boat in the Gulf of Mexico, this episode of Stomping Grounds has host Ryan McVinney exploring boat culture in Florida’s Panhandle region, from the Emerald Coast to The Big Bend and the Forgotten Coast. Brian Kelley, aka “Beach Cowboy”, or BK for short, makes up one half of the country music group Florida Georgia Line (FGL) and has just released his own solo album Sunshine State of Mind. Kelley invites viewers aboard his vessel the “Brittney Marie” which was named after his wife, for a look at the couple’s Stomping Grounds. Songs from his album play on the boat’s sound system - including a tune about shopping for a boat on Boat Trader

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: When Plan A and Plan B don't go as planned, Destin always has a way of bailing you out.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Denise Sanchez was awarded a hunt at G2 following our Hunters Extravaganza drawings. Its great to get to spend time on the ranch with new members of TTHA. Denise gets familiar with a giant and learns about new technology while on this hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our college chapters. Hudson has been a long time member of TTHA as well as serving with the Texas A&M Chapter. We have a great time at G2 in pursuit of Axis deer.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Anyone can be a cowboy—that’s the biggest thing the DIRT crew learned in Texas. From riding bulls in Fort Worth to off-roading in the Chihuahuan desert to forging their own path across this vast state with the help of local trailblazers Liz and Lou Lambert. Lucky for us, they even stopped by Huckberry’s own backyard in Austin for a quick ruck and a couple games of chicken sh*t bingo. When the dust finally settled, we fired up the barbecue for our beefiest feast yet and raised our ranch waters high to 10 DIRT episodes in the can.

programme.title: Gear Lab
programme.desc: Our friend and host of DIRT, Josh Rosen, stopped by the Gear Lab to show us what he packed for our most recent DIRT episode in Alaska.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate – outside – in Palm Beach County FL.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchester’s best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team follows the project of a detailed retrofitting of a Bertram upgrading from one motor to twin engines with the help of an Armstrong Bracket. The team then heads to Boatwrench Inc. to rebuild the carburetor for the Glastron project.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team does a deep dive into a product founded by Engineered Marine Coatings called the Genius Bucket. The Genius Bucket being the ultimate DIY paint kit for those looking to tackle a marine painting job on there own. The team also checks out the capabilities it takes to restoring the older metal rub rail which derived from the Glastron project.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade shows us around some of his investment properties, and Ryan kills a nice bull elk in New Mexico.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade takes us around the hometown hunting grounds and shows us some of the last bits of preparation for the season. An old buck that’s been showing up on camera at night decides to daylight and pays the price.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When the Bay Point Billfish Open returns, we hop on board the Ellie B for some offshore competition and follow the event’s epic dockside party.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin & Meredith’s beautiful Panama City Beach morning is met with a slack tide so a new path to redfish success is found under a popular bridge.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesn’t come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: After several years of shifting focus back to his native whitetails, Dahlke returns to mule deer country with the Muley Freak, Erik Van Woerkom. Follow along on this Utah mule deer hunt.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: For decades, Paul Butski has set the standard in turkey calling. His name is etched into the NWTF Grand National Calling Championships Hall of Fame, and his influence stretches far beyond the stage. He didn’t just win competitions, he shaped the way we talk to turkeys – and more importantly, the way we hunt them.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Todd Rogers embraces the business of being a hunting outfitter as a labor of love. And while so many family-run operations are dwindling in rural America, the Rogers legacy is here to stay. Will Cooper and Josh Dahlke return to western Oklahoma to share this story while pursuing brush-country whitetails in the red dirt.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we dive into how we are using our knowledge and experience to not only get some amazing hunting property, but to have other people pay for it. Sound too good to be true? We also take you on some great hunts we’ve had on our journey flipping land and think back on some memories from the past and what the future is going to look like. We hope you can learn a thing or two in this episode and encourage you to reach out with any questions you may have about this process.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are back in Missouri on our new farm that we’ve recently purchased. We developed our last farm, and did a 1031 tax free exchange to buy this farm so we can develop and sell it later on. This is the first time we’ve seen the property, so we are finding out what we are going to do with it and how we are going to lay it out. Once we get that figured out, we go into the dirty work of planting, moving box stands, and making sure everything is good for hunting season. Fast forward and we have two amazing hunts where both Ryan and myself take awesome bucks with our bows. This one has it all! Do not miss it!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes you on a ride through one of the coolest cities in the south, the historic Natchez, Mississippi. This is an area in which Slade sells a lot of hunting land and being only 40 minutes from where he grew up, Slade is very familiar with all there is to do in the area not only from a recreational standpoint but also for entertainment. Slade takes you through the showing process on a beautiful piece of property and bring it full circle at the closing. You’ll also watch a deer hunt with Slade in Natchez that was featured on Realtree Monster Bucks DVD. This is a jampacked episode with so much to learn and also enjoy. We know you’ll love it.

programme.desc: John Wick is on the run. With a $14M price tag on his head, he is the target of hit men and women everywhere.

programme.title: Man Of Tai Chi
programme.desc: A young martial artist's unparalleled Tai Chi skills land him in a highly lucrative underworld fight club.

programme.title: Siberia
programme.desc: After an American diamond merchant and his lover fall into a bad business deal in Russia, they must evade crossfire between the buyer and the Feds.

programme.title: Knock Knock
programme.desc: A man's quiet night at home turns into a nightmarish moral inquisition when two gorgeous and treacherous women show up on his doorstep.

programme.title: Warm Bodies

Soon after, he's placed in a recovery ward where he begins the arduous process of rehabilitation and meets others with injuries like his own. Raymond (Wesley Snipes) is a ladies' man whose girl has nevertheless split, and Bloss (William Forsythe) is a rather prejudiced biker. Together, this unlikely trio helps one another to overcome the greatest challenge of their lives.

programme.title: Immediate Family

programme.title: Sueño

programme.title: The Broken Hearts Club: A Romantic Comedy

programme.title: Sunset
programme.desc: Bruce Willis and James Garner star as 1920s legends, actor Tom Mix and crimefighter Wyatt Earp, who join forces to solve a Beverly Hills killing.

programme.title: Sahara

programme.title: Family Business

programme.title: Switching Channels

programme.title: Now Is Good

programme.title: Peggy Sue Got Married

programme.title: Dear Eleanor
